question: 先頃
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>previous</kanji> <kanji>approximate</kanji> was the previous approximate time, which is <vocabulary>recently</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>the other day</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the kun'yomi vocab readings of the two kanji. That's <ja>先</ja> and <ja>頃</ja> (the reading you learned) put together. The <ja>頃</ja> is the rendaku'd version, <ja>ごろ</ja> so be careful.
